description: A widget that can display a web page. Since this widget requires a lot of resources it's recommended to have no more than one instance at a time.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

url.description: The URL of the web page to display. Relative URLs are resolved relative to 'package.json'. Returns empty string when content from *html* property is displayed.

html.description: A complete HTML document to display. Always returns the last set value.

canGoForward.description: Whether there is a next page to navigate to via `goForward()`.

canGoBack.description: Whether there is a previous to navigated to via `goBack()`.

navigate.description: Fired when the WebView is about to navigate to a new URL.

preventDefault.description: Call to intercept the navigation.  Not possible when the event is only an anchor navigation

url.description: The new URL the WebView is about to navigate to.

load.description: Fired when the url has been loaded.

download.description: Fired when the WebView requests a download. The download event provides the properties `url`, `mimeType`, `contentLength` and `contentDisposition`. Supported only on Android.

url.description: The URL of the resource to be downloaded.

mimeType.description: The mime type of the resource to be downloaded.

contentLength.description: The size of the downloaded entity body.

contentDisposition.description: Indicates whether the download is expected to be displayed inline or to be downloaded as an attachment.

message.description: Fired when a web message has been sent via `window.parent.postMessage(message, targetOrigin)` from inside the `WebView`.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send. Currently supports only strings.

parameters.name: targetOrigin
parameters.description: The URL of the page that receives the message. The message is only sent if the current document URL has the same scheme, domain and path. Use `*` to send to any URL.

postMessage.description: Posts a web message to the underlying `window` object of the WebView. The website in the `WebView` can register for the message in the following fashion: `window.addEventListener('message', callbackFunction)`. For more information see [`Window.postMessage()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Window/postMessage) API.

goBack.description: Navigate the `WebView` to the previous page if possible.

goForward.description: Navigate the `WebView` to the next page if possible.
